title: Avril Haines
added: ==== Support for Haspel as CIA Director ====

In 2018, Haines was an outspoken supporter of President [[Donald Trump]]'s controversial nomination of [[Gina Haspel]] to serve as CIA director. While not commenting on Haspel's record, she praised her knowledge of the agency and intelligence, a position hailed by the White House as it promoted Haspel's confirmation.<ref name="ct20180318">{{cite news|last=Reichmann|first=Deb|date=March 18, 2018|title=Trump's pick to lead CIA to face questions about torture|agency=[[Associated Press]]|url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/nation-world/ct-trump-cia-director-20180313-story.html|url-status=live|access-date=June 21, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200726211649/https://www.chicagotribune.com/nation-world/ct-trump-cia-director-20180313-story.html|archive-date=July 26, 2020}}</ref><ref name="wh">{{cite web|date=May 8, 2018|title=Gina Haspel Has Defended Our National Security|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefings-statements/gina-haspel-defended-national-security/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180508210800/https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefings-statements/gina-haspel-defended-national-security/|archive-date=May 8, 2018|access-date=May 8, 2018|website=whitehouse.gov|publisher=White House}}</ref>  Critics of Haines' endorsement of Haspel said Haspel was reportedly involved in the operations of CIA secret black site torture sites in 2002 and 2003 and had supported waterboarding.<ref name="auto1"/> Haspel also has admitted her role in helping destroy videotapes of torture by CIA interrogators.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Kessler|first=Glenn|date=May 10, 2018|title=CIA director nominee Haspel and the destruction of interrogation tapes: Contradictions and questions|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/fact-checker/wp/2018/05/11/cia-director-nominee-haspel-and-destruction-of-interrogation-tapes-contradictions-and-questions/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180711183805/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/fact-checker/wp/2018/05/11/cia-director-nominee-haspel-and-destruction-of-interrogation-tapes-contradictions-and-questions/|archive-date=July 11, 2018|access-date=July 16, 2018|newspaper=[[Washington Post]]}}</ref> At least one progressive nonprofit leader has said he or she feared "professional reprisal" for speaking out publicly in criticism of Haines' support of Haspel as CIA director.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Kaye|first=Jeffrey|date=July 8, 2020|title=Biden Advisor an "Apologist for Torture," an Architect of "Kill Lists"|url=http://accuracy.org/release/biden-advisor-an-apologist-for-torture-an-architect-of-kill-lists/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200722231647/http://accuracy.org/release/biden-advisor-an-apologist-for-torture-an-architect-of-kill-lists/|archive-date=July 22, 2020|access-date=July 16, 2020|website=[[Institute for Public Accuracy]]}}</ref>

title: Avril Haines
added: Senators who voted no were: Marsha Blackburn, Mike Braun, Ted Cruz, Joni Ernst, Bill Hagerty, Josh Hawley, Mike Lee, Roger Marshall, Rand Paul, and James Risch. There is a huge overlap of senators who voted no and senators who tried to overthrow the government by attempting to invalidate the electoral college votes in a bid to prevent Joe Biden from being confirmed.

title: Avril Haines
deleted: Senators who voted no were: Marsha Blackburn, Mike Braun, Ted Cruz, Joni Ernst, Bill Hagerty, Josh Hawley, Mike Lee, Roger Marshall, Rand Paul, and James Risch. title: Avril Haines
deleted: <ref name=Note01>Haines has been confirmed, but is not yet sworn-in, and does not yet hold the powers of Director of National Intelligence.</ref>
